channel.title: Roberto L. Delgado
channel.description: Essays and notes by Roberto L. Delgado.

item.title: Questions About Her
item.description: Questions about agency, opacity, and trust in transformative machines.

item.title: Less and More
item.description: Minimalism and maximalism are both wrong.

item.title: If Can Can, If No Can No Can.
item.description: Turns out that the possible and impossible, also known as the counterfactual, has been neglected in physics.

item.title: The Power of Iron John
item.description: I've been thinking a lot about honor recently, specifically the question of how we can properly honor the things and people in our lives.

item.title: Julius Lester and the Gift of Failure
item.description: He was the type of teacher that expected the highest rigor in the things that are usually given short shrift.

item.title: Names
item.description: A name does not exist by itself, but only in relation to something else.

item.title: Signal and Noise
item.description: What's underappreciated today is what the information pioneers did to the noise vs. signal ratio.

item.title: The FOCUS Framework
item.description: Product market fit means satisfying a market that satisfies you.
